ratings.comment: He once did a problem where the angles of a triangle were labeled as an obtuse triangle, a triangle with a right angle and an acute triangle. The sides were just larger versions of each triangle.

I took Calc II with Professor Choi. The material is difficult, and the lectures are not always clear. There is no textbook - just a course packet that's not always helpful. The tests were extremely hard, but the curve is forgiving. Be ready to spend a lot of time outside class trying to figure out problems. Discussions were not very helpful either.

Has a pretty tough accent to get used to, but you get used to it after a while if you pay attention. His lecture notes are worth writing down like 90% of the time: he gives good examples. Your TA will make or break you, if you end up with a cruddy TA, it's not hard to go to another, either for discussion or lecture. Make sure you go hard on HW.

He does have accent but it's not a big problem. He doesn't explain much as like American teachers do, but he can explain problems pretty clear. His notes are very organized and examples are helpful to the exams. If you understand the lecture notes well and review the problems in the book before the tests, the exams are fair games.

Cannot understand why other people give him such low rate. He shows how to finish the examples on the lecture and the examples are useful. Explains students questions  well if you ask him after the lecture. His accent is not a problem.

Professor Choi was a better professor than I had expected. He isn't that hard to understand, and his lectures are him going through the textbook - helpful. I found exams to not be impossible, probably because I did my homework and went to every lecture and discussion. Applies curve after final exam. Allows a note sheet for midterms AND final exam!

Hes pathetic at teaching and you're gonna have to rely a lot on your TAs for everything. I had learnt all this matter in highschool so the course was easy for me.  If you dont like math or are new to all the concepts in this course, hes just gonna make things worse. Pretty much all the examples he gives in class are from the textbook.

Yes he has an accent but he can't really help that. His notes are organized but mainly consist of proofs that are already in the book and he provides very little explanation. I got A's on quizzes and homework but as for the tests, don't let the allowed cheat sheet fool you, they will still be extremely difficult. You need a good TA to pass.
Tough class, but definitely not as bad as most people would say.

I'm getting D's on the tests but an A in the class, this may speak to the fact that he makes the tests so hard that the curve has to be that big. He mainly uses proofs to teach and leaves the TA's to actually teach you how to go about doing a problem. When he tries to explain things he just says, "This is easy, yeah."
Not as bad as everyone makes him out to be, but still pretty bad.   Meow.
Some people are smart but that doesn't mean they can teach. 010 wish I knew how terrible he was so I could've at least taken the less  horrible calc 222 teacher.

I can't figure out what bothers me most, the fact that he can't speak english or that his handwriting is like hieroglyphics? Anyways, try to attend every lecture, as a lot of the test questions are in the notes or in the homework. If you do this and study hard, you may be able to pass the most failed class at UW.

There is almost no need to say it. This organism started at 1.68 a week ago. He is now at 1.21. Is there anything left to say?  Trust me, through the multide of "ya's" and *sighs*, your semester will be totally wasted in the drain. Good luck whoever ends up with this masterful being.  <3 <3 Prepare to ask your TA unlimited questions!
By far the worst ever. Trust me do not take him. You will definitely regret. I hope he gets fired.

The university needs to read these reviews and do something about it because Kyudong is by far the worst professor I have had. I learned everything on my own. Every lecture was useless. He literally sounds like he is speaking korean or chinese to an english speaking group of students. He writes in his own weird writing style that nobody can read.

He only tests you on memorization since each of the exams consists of mainly proofs. He doesn't test on the actual material you learn, instead you are expected to memorize proofs. It made no sense to me. I am really curious to know what criteria was used to select him to teach for the course.

Nuff said! Just read all the other posts on here. THEY ARE COMPLETELY TRUE. I agree that he is a total embarrassment for such a great university. This was my worst professor ever. I don't think it can get any more worst than this guy.

Awful. Exams all proofs, takes off more points than problems are worth. Barely speaks English. Cannot comprehend questions, tells you to "look in book". Notes straight from textbook. You will want to deck him 3 weeks into the semester. An embarrassment to a great University.

The worst professor ever! I don't even know how they let him teach this course. I couldn't read what he wrote on the board or understand what he was saying in lectures due to his thick Asian accent. Good luck! Exams only test proofs which are impossible.
Honestly the worst professor! Plus the worst TA to go with it. His exams were basically all proofs. Hardly any calculations. Extremely difficult. Plus I could barely understand him.

If you take this guy, GOOD LUCK! This is the only professor I have had that actually makes simple material more confusing and difficult to understand. Hard to comprehend what he says during lecture. I would NOT recommend him to even my enemies. Bad. He does not like to be corrected when he makes mistakes. Highly un-recommended. A very bad grader.

DO NOT TAKE ANY COURSE WITH KYUDONG! He is nice but extremely difficult to understand. Both his speaking, and writing skills need MUCH improvement. I cannot read his notes even if I sit up close to the board. Exams are all proof based. Difficult quizzes. The material in the course is presented in a very confusing manner. Never Again!!!

He speaks in a SUPER thick accent. It takes you the entire semester to understand what he is saying up there. He really does NOT know how to teach although he knows the subject well. All exams were based on proofs and difficult. Going to class is very annoying since he makes the material very confusing. I wish he would know how to 'teach'.TERRIBLE!
Exams consist of almost all proofs. Hard to understand most of the time. Avoid taking a class with him if possible
He probably knows a lot. But, I do not think he is good at teaching this course.
